VISION.name: Vision equipment
VISION.description:
This involves various light sources, tactile investigatory methods, and other "hands-on" equipment which will not damage the item being examined. This  may be used by anyone and [primary]must[] be taken along by the team.
Usually has high investigation chance, but also a high backfire probability. Useful, but dangerous.

SIMPLE TOOLS.name: Simple tools
SIMPLE TOOLS.description:
Cutting  tools, hammers, torches, and so forth, designed to "break into" the item being examined. Only an [primary]Astronaut[] may use it.
Has medium investigation chance, but also high backfire; definitely a "blast of dynamite" approach.

OHMMETER.name: Ohmmeter
OHMMETER.description:
Used to measure electrical activity. Anyone may use this equipment.
Has a medium investigation chance and low backfire chance. When it does backfire, the results are often impressive (often in an unfortunate way).

MAGNETOMETER.name: Magnetometer
MAGNETOMETER.description:
Used to measure the strength of magnetic field. Only an [primary]Astronaut[] or [primary]Engineer[] may use it.
Has a medium investigation chance with low backfire.

GEIGER COUNTER.name: Geiger counter
GEIGER COUNTER.description:
Used to measure radio-activity. Only [primary]Physicist or [primary]Astronaut[] may use this.
Has a very low investigation chance with almost no chance backfire.

RADIO RECEIVER.name: Radio receiver
RADIO RECEIVER.description:
Used to detect radio frequencies on wide spectrum. Anyone may use this.
Has a medium investigation chance and a medium backfire.

INFRARED.name: Infrared
INFRARED.description:
Used to detect infrared radiations. Anyone may use this.
Has medium investigation chance and medium backfire chance.

RECORDING EQUIPMENT.name: Recording equipment
RECORDING EQUIPMENT.description:
Includes all manner of electronic and visual record-making equipment. Anyone may use this.
Used only to reread previously investigated messages.
